intro: Diplycosia lysolepis, commonly known as the slender leaf diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. It typically grows in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
